de.fzi.replica.comm
Interface CommManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
CommManagerImpl
public interface CommManager

CommManager can handle multiple connections to other peers and provides access to all ECF components relevant to the Replica project through the Connection interface.

Version:
version, 31.10.2010
Author:
Jan Novacek novacek@fzi.de, jannvck@gmail.com

setConfiguration

void setConfiguration(java.util.Properties config)
Set the configuration. The Configuration has to be set prior to connecting. Reasonable defaults for missing configuration properties will be chosen otherwise.
If you want to customize the configuration of your implementation when extending a CommManager implementation you can override this method to set your own parameters but make sure you call this method and also to override getConfiguration().

The configuration can also define defaults for connections. All configuration properties of a Connection can also be specified here. If a configuration key is missing when configuring a Connection, the value specified in the CommManager configuration will be applied.
Recognized configuration key/value pairs
KeyDescription
defaultContainerTypeThe default type of the underlying ECF container instance.
defaultContainerIDThe default ID of the container.
defaultTargetIDThe default target ID.
TODO DEFAULTS ARE NOT WORKING YET, EVERY CONNECTION HAS TO BE CONFIGURED MANUALLY

See Also:
Connection

getConfiguration

java.util.Properties getConfiguration()
Returns the configuration.
If you want to customize the configuration of your application you can override this method to return your configuration parameters but make sure you also add the Properties supplied by this method to your configuration properties.
Have a look at the setConfiguration() documentation for a description of all configuration keys.

See Also:
setConfiguration(java.util.Properties)
